column4: hi, i have a digital camera that mounts sdcard as gphoto2.  i'm wondering if i can use the sdcard directly as a block device.  i want to dd to the card, i don't have  a regular card reader
why do you need to dd the card?
to put an bootable image on it for raspberry pi
oh, ok. if you have it mounted run "mount" to find out where the block device is
no guarantees however on how the camera's interface works.
i don't see it in mount.  nautilus shows the location asgphoto2://[usb:003,005]/
i guess i probably need a real card reader
if that doesn't work, I have one more little trick you can try
sucks cause i have one in my laptop but it doesn't seem to recognize.  possibly because i dropped the laptop and it's cracked right there at the sd slot
run "ls /dev/ > 1" then unplug it and count to 10. then run "ls /dev/ > 2" and then "diff 1 2"
try "ls -R" instead of "ls" in both instances
if that doesn't show anything, then it's probably a weird protocol
your camera may have an "act as removeable storage" mode or something you can turn on (my gps has the same thing)
if i do ls -R then i can see, there is /dev/bus/usb/003/006  and /dev/char/189:261

yeah, then it's definitely a special protocol. if you can find a setting in the camera to change the usb mode, then that might work. otherwise you're SOL as far as using the camera for a block device interface
ok, kinda what i figured, thanks anyways
